page.title: 16ROADS AROUND SOUTH ROCHDALE
page.content: The main roads in this area are the road from Rochdale to Manchester and the road from Rochdale to Oldham. Crossing our area is the M62 motorway which goes from Liverpool on the west coast to Hull on the east coast. These roads carry a great deal of traffic nowadays but one hundred years ago the motorway did not exist and the other main roads were narrow, rough and stony. In 1800 a postboy was roobed whilst delivering mail on the road at Castleton. A man was caught for highway robbery and sentanced to death. The main roads led to a lot of industrial development in the area, which continues today because of the nearby motorway.
